paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Familial amyloidosis, including cardiac and extracardiac manifestations

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients were divided into three groups: 1- Val30Met with cardiac amyloidosis; 2-Val30Met with extracardiac amyloidosis; 3 - Val30Met without evidence of disease.

Patients were divided into three groups: 1- Val30Met with cardiac amyloidosis; 2-Val30Met with extracardiac amyloidosis; 3 - Val30Met without evidence of disease.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with familial amyloidosis, affecting cardiac and extracardiac tissues.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, as indicated by the grouping of patients based on disease presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of echocardiography in diagnosing early stages of familial amyloidosis caused by the Val30Met mutation.
key_quotes: The most common type of familial amyloidosis is mediated by mutation of transthyretin, especially Val30Met.
Patients were divided into three groups: 1- Val30Met with cardiac amyloidosis; 2-Val30Met with extracardiac amyloidosis; 3 - Val30Met without evidence of disease.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant Val30Met was extracted successfully.
